intro: Cynoglossospermum diploloma, commonly known as the two-seed mercurial, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique two-seeded capsule. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, open habitats.
